2.  **Part 1: Theoretical Foundation (Chain Complexes, Cycles, Boundaries)**
    *   *Definition of Chain Complex:* A sequence of abelian groups/modules $C_n$ connected by boundary maps $\partial_n: C_n \to C_{n-1}$ such that $\partial_{n-1} \circ \partial_n = 0$.
    *   *Definition of Cycles ($Z_n$):* The kernel of the boundary map, $\ker(\partial_n)$. Elements that map to zero.
    *   *Definition of Boundaries ($B_n$):* The image of the boundary map, $\text{im}(\partial_{n+1})$. Elements that come from something else.
    *   *Homology ($H_n$):* The quotient group $H_n = Z_n / B_n$. This measures "holes" or "cycles that aren't boundaries".
